tit.cmt: 用語集では(lacquered)と補足されていますが。この内容ではさまざまな材質のものが説明されているため、省きました。

sen.j: 茶托（ちゃたく）は茶碗をのせる受け皿。
sen.e: Chataku is a tea bowl saucer.
Chataku is a tea bowl saucer.
Chataku is a tea bowl saucer.

sen.j: 最も茶を飲むときに絶対に必要な物ではないため、日常生活では使わないことが多い。
sen.e: However it is not an essential item to have a cup of tea and not commonly used in daily life.
sen.cmt: 「最も」ではなく、「尤も」ではないかと思われます。
sen.e: However it is not an essential item to have a cup of tea and not commonly used in daily life.
However it is not an essential item to have a cup of tea and not commonly used in daily life.

sen.j: 逆に、客を接待するときには相手に対する敬意を表すために必ず使用する。
sen.e: On the contrary, it is always used to serve guests to show respect.
On the contrary, it is always used to serve guests to show respect.
On the contrary, it is always used to serve guests to show respect.

sen.j: また、抹茶を飲む茶碗にも使わない。
sen.e: It is not used for tea bowl for drinking powdered green tea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is not used for tea bowl for drinking Matcha (powdered green tea).
It is not used for tea bowl for drinking Matcha (powdered green tea).

sen.j: （但し、茶道では天目台という茶托に似た道具がある。）
sen.e: (However there is a tea utensil, similar to chataku, called a tea-bowl stand in Sado.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (However there is a tea utensil, similar to chataku, called Tenmokudai [a tea-bowl stand] in Sado [Japanese tea ceremony].)
(However there is a tea utensil, similar to chataku, called Tenmokudai [a tea-bowl stand] in Sado [Japanese tea ceremony].)

sen.j: 紅茶、コーヒーなどヨーロッパ式の茶を飲む道具では、茶托の代わりにカップと同柄のソーサーが使われる。
sen.e: Instead of chataku, a saucer in same pattern as the teacup is used for European style drinks like a cup of black tea or coffee.
Instead of chataku, a saucer in same pattern as the teacup is used for European style drinks like a cup of black tea or coffee.
Instead of chataku, a saucer in same pattern as the teacup is used for European style drinks like a cup of black tea or coffee.

sen.j: 煎茶道の茶托
sen.e: Chataku in senchado (the way of brewed green tea)
Chataku in Senchado (Japanese tea ceremony using Sencha [brewed green tea])
sen.cmt: 用語補足を変えました。
sen.e: Chataku in Senchado (Japanese tea ceremony using Sencha [brewed green tea])

sen.j: 異称
sen.e: Different name
Different name
Different name

sen.j: 流派によっては「托子」「茶台」「茶托子」「納敬（のうけい）」などと呼ばれる。
sen.e: Chataku is also called in various names such as takushi, chadai, chatakushi and nokei, depending on styles.
sen.cmt: 用語集では各呼び方ごとに（teacup saucer）となっていましたが、こちらでは重複しすぎるので省いています。
sen.e: Chataku is also called in various names such as 'takushi,' 'chadai,' 'chatakushi' and 'nokei,' depending on schools.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足し用語を変えました。
sen.e: Chataku is also called in various names such as 'takushi,' 'chadai,' 'chatakushi' and 'nokei,' depending on schools.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 明から伝来した煎茶法を起源とする日本の煎茶道では、元々茶托に当たる物はなかったと考えられている。
sen.e: It is believed that there was no utensil equivalent for chataku in Japanese senchado, which originate in senchaho (method of green tea) introduced from Ming Dynasty.
It is believed that there was no utensil equivalent for chataku in Japanese Senchado, which originate in Senchaho (method of green tea) introduced from Ming Dynasty.
It is believed that there was no utensil equivalent for chataku in Japanese Senchado, which originate in Senchaho (method of green tea) introduced from Ming Dynasty.

sen.j: 茶碗はすべて盆にのせられ、客は銘々茶碗をとって飲用するという作法だったと推測されている。
sen.e: The presumed manner is that tea bowls were all put on a tray and each guest takes a tea bowl from the tray.
The presumed manner is that tea bowls were all put on a tray and each guest takes a tea bowl from the tray.
The presumed manner is that tea bowls were all put on a tray and each guest takes a tea bowl from the tray.

sen.j: 江戸時代中期に清から杯と杯台が輸入されるようになる。
sen.e: Import of sakazuki (drinking cup) and stand of a drinking cup from Qing Dynasty started in the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処用語集ではthe Qing dynastyでしたが、先にでた明にあわせQing Dynastyとしました。
sen.e: Import of sakazuki (drinking cup) and sakazuki-dai (stand for sakazuki) from Qing Dynasty started in the middle of the Edo period.
Import of sakazuki (drinking cup) and sakazuki-dai (stand for sakazuki) from Qing Dynasty started in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 日本の煎茶法でこの杯を茶碗に転用する際に、杯台が茶托に転じた物と考えられる。
sen.e: It is believed that a stand for a drinking cup changed to chataku when the sakazuki was transferred to tea bowl for Japanese senchaho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is believed that a sakazuki-dai stand was transferred to chataku in Japanese Senchaho, together with sakazuki to tea bowl.
It is believed that a sakazuki-dai stand was transferred to chataku in Japanese Senchaho, together with sakazuki to tea bowl.

sen.j: 輸入杯台は錫製が大半であり、結果、日本の煎茶道では現在に至るまで錫製の茶托を最上とするようになった。
sen.e: Majority of imported stands for a drinking cup was made by tin, therefore tin chataku is considered the finest in Japanses senchado to present days.
Majority of imported sakazuki-dai was made by tin, therefore tin chataku is considered the finest in Japanese Senchado until today.
Majority of imported sakazuki-dai was made by tin, therefore tin chataku is considered the finest in Japanese Senchado until today.

sen.j: その後、木製茶托も生産されるようになった。
sen.e: Later on wooden chataku are also produced.
Later on wooden chataku are also produced.
Later on wooden chataku are also produced.

sen.j: 錫製の茶托は煎茶、玉露などの高級茶を入れる小さめの茶碗に。
sen.e: Tin chataku is used for smaller tea bowl, which is used for high-class tea such as sencha (green tea of middle grade) and Gyokuro (refined green tea).
Tin chataku is used for smaller tea bowl, which is used for high-class tea such as Sencha (green tea of middle grade) and Gyokuro (refined green tea).
Tin chataku is used for smaller tea bowl, which is used for high-class tea such as Sencha (green tea of middle grade) and Gyokuro (refined green tea).

sen.j: 木製の茶碗は番茶など普段用の茶を入れる大きめの茶碗に合わせるのが正当とされる。
sen.e: Proper use of wooden chataku is for larger tea bowls, which is used for casual tea such as bancha (coarse tea).
Proper use of wooden chataku is for larger tea bowls, which is used for casual tea such as Bancha (coarse tea).
Proper use of wooden chataku is for larger tea bowls, which is used for casual tea such as Bancha (coarse tea).

sen.j: 最も、木製の茶托でも輪島塗や鎌倉彫など錫製の茶托より遙かに高価な物も少なくない。
sen.e: However some wooden chataku, such as wajima-nuri lacquerware and Kamakura-bori (articles chiseled in hardwood and repeatedly lacquered in black and vermilion) is priced far more higher than tin chataku.
sen.cmt: 「最も」ではなく、「尤も」であると思われます。
sen.e: However, many wooden chataku, such as with wajima-nuri lacquerware and Kamakura-bori (articles chiseled in hardwood and repeatedly lacquered in black and vermilion) are priced far more higher than tin chataku.

However, many wooden chataku, such as with wajima-nuri lacquerware and Kamakura-bori (articles chiseled in hardwood and repeatedly lacquered in black and vermilion) are priced far more higher than tin chataku.

sen.j: 錫製の茶托については、煎茶道では年代を経て黒ずんでいる物の方が価値が高いとされる。
sen.e: As for tin chataku, the older and blackened item is valued higher in senchado.
As for tin chataku, the older and blackened is valued higher in Senchado.
As for tin chataku, the older and blackened is valued higher in Senchado.

sen.j: また楕円形より円形の方がいいとされている。
sen.e: Also round shaped item is said to be better than oval shaped item.
Also round shaped chataku is said to be better than oval shaped.
Also round shaped chataku is said to be better than oval shaped.

sen.j: 中国製では「張星栄造」「肖天泰」「乾茂号造」などの銘が入っている物、国産では泰造六作成の物は高価で取り引きされている。
sen.e: Tin chataku with inscriptions, such as "張星栄造(Choseieizo)", "肖天泰 (Shotentai)" and "乾茂号造 (Kanmogozo)" for Chinese made, and "泰造六作成 (Taizorokusakusei)" for Japanese made, are traded with high price.
sen.cmt: 「銘」とあるので、実際の漢字も載せた方がよいと思い、漢字、ローマ字両方を載せました。
sen.e: Chinese tin chataku with inscriptions, such as '張星栄造' (Choseieizo), '肖天泰' (Shotentai) and '乾茂号造' (Kanmogozo), and Japanese tin chataku created by Zoroku HATA, are traded with high price.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました（「泰造六」は正しくは「秦蔵六」と思われます）。
sen.e: Chinese tin chataku with inscriptions, such as '張星栄造' (Choseieizo), '肖天泰' (Shotentai) and '乾茂号造' (Kanmogozo), and Japanese tin chataku created by Zoroku HATA, are traded with high price.

sen.j: 作法の注意
sen.e: Attention to manner
Attention to manner
Attention to manner

sen.j: 煎茶道の流派により様々だが、茶を飲み終わった後は茶碗を茶托に伏せるのを推奨する流派と、茶托に茶渋が付くとして厳禁する流派がある。
sen.e: Depending on styles, some recommend lying tea bowl upside down on to chataku after finish drinking tea, but some strictly forbid doing so as tea staining will stain chataku.
The manner varies with the schools; a school recommends lying tea bowl upside down on to chataku after finish drinking tea, while other strictly forbids doing so as tea staining will stain chataku.
The manner varies with the schools; a school recommends lying tea bowl upside down on to chataku after finish drinking tea, while other strictly forbids doing so as tea staining will stain chataku.

sen.j: 中国茶の茶托
sen.e: Chataku for Chinese tea
Chataku for Chinese tea
Chataku for Chinese tea

sen.j: 唐時代に喫茶の風習が始まった中国では、熱湯を入れた茶碗を直接持たなくてもいいように茶托にあたる物があったとされる。
sen.e: In China, a custom of tea drinking started in the Tang period and is believed that there was a utensil equivalent to chataku, so drinker do not need to hold tea bowl containing boiling water.
In China, a custom of tea drinking started in the Tang period and is believed that there was a utensil equivalent to chataku, so drinker do not need to hold tea bowl containing boiling water.
In China, a custom of tea drinking started in the Tang period and is believed that there was a utensil equivalent to chataku, so drinker do not need to hold tea bowl containing boiling water.

sen.j: しかし茶の飲用方の変化によりその後廃絶、近年の茶芸によって復活した。
sen.e: However the utensil had disappeared due to change in the way of having tea in later period, and is restored by art of tea in recent years.
However the utensil had disappeared due to change in the way of having tea in later period, and is restored by art of tea in recent years.
However the utensil had disappeared due to change in the way of having tea in later period, and is restored by art of tea in recent years.

sen.j: 形式には、茶杯だけをのせる円形の物、茶杯と聞香杯をのせられる長方形・楕円形の物がある。
sen.e: There are few forms in chataku, such as round shaped chataku only for placing chahai (drinking cup for tea), and oval or rectangular shaped chataku for placing chahai and monkohai (drinking cup for tea especially for enjoying tea scent before drinking).

There are some forms in chataku, such as round shaped chataku only for placing chahai (drinking cup for tea), and oval or rectangular shaped for placing chahai and monkohai (drinking cup for tea especially for enjoying tea scent before drinking).

There are some forms in chataku, such as round shaped chataku only for placing chahai (drinking cup for tea), and oval or rectangular shaped for placing chahai and monkohai (drinking cup for tea especially for enjoying tea scent before drinking).

sen.j: 材質は木製、金属製、陶磁器製など。
sen.e: Materials are wooden, metals or ceramic.
The materials are wooden, metals or ceramic, and so on.
The materials are wooden, metals or ceramic, and so on.

sen.j: 煎茶の茶托は茶碗の高台に合わせた円形のくぼみが付いていることが多いが、中国茶の茶托は単なる小さい皿か盆のような形状をしている物が多い。
sen.e: Chataku for sencha often have a concavity matched to kodai (the base section of a teacup) of tea bowl, but majority of chataku for Chinese tea has a shape of small plate or tray.
Chataku for Sencha often have a concavity matched to kodai (the base section of a teacup) of tea bowl, but majority of chataku for Chinese tea has a simple shape of small plate or tray.
Chataku for Sencha often have a concavity matched to kodai (the base section of a teacup) of tea bowl, but majority of chataku for Chinese tea has a simple shape of small plate or tray.
